attributes.action: actively support the Colombian government's projects to reduce cocaine production
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Cocaine addiction in the UK has recently grown to almost epidemic levels, supported by the ignorant belief that it is a "victimless" drug and the increased acceptance of its use by popular celebrities (whom the Labour government have long tried to associate themselves with).
Sales of cocaine in the UK have allowed Colombian narcoterrorist groups such as the FARC and ELN to continue their "war" on the law abiding citizens of Colombia as well as accelerating environmental destruction of tropical rainforest.
Colombia is now fighting back and it needs the help of European countries to assist; through direct aid to help eradicate cocaine production, but also through increased educational programmes in the UK highlighting the true cost of the drug (to reduce the demand) and the removal of import subsidies to allow Colombia to develop alternative export economies.
The UK must take positive steps now, because if not, the future cost to the UK economy and the world's environment is unacceptable.
